sen.j: 妻木 煕子（つまき ひろこ、享禄3年（1530年）頃 - 天正4年11月7日_(旧暦)（1576年11月27日）?）は戦国時代 (日本)、安土桃山時代の武将明智光秀の2番目の妻。
sen.e: Hiroko TSUMAKI (about 1530 - November 27, 1576?) was the second wife of Mitsuhide AKECHI, a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (Japan) and Azuchi-Momoyama period.

Hiroko TSUMAKI (c. 1530 - November 27, 1576) was the second wife of Mitsuhide AKECHI, a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) and Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。”戦国時代”の部分を修正しました。
sen.e: Hiroko TSUMAKI (c. 1530 - November 27, 1576) was the second wife of Mitsuhide AKECHI, a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) (Japan) and Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Her name was also known as Hiroko
Her name was also known as Hiroko (照子).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを挿入しました。「ひろこ」として同じなので”（照子）”を補いました。
sen.e: Her name was also known as Hiroko (照子).

sen.j: 子に細川ガラシャ（細川忠興正室）。
sen.e: Her children include Gracia HOSOKAWA (Tadaoki HOSOKAWA's lawful wife).
Her children include Gracia HOSOKAWA (Tadaoki HOSOKAWA's lawful wife).
Her children include Gracia HOSOKAWA (Tadaoki HOSOKAWA's lawful wife).

sen.j: 享禄3年（1530年）頃の生れと考えられる。
sen.e: It is believed that she was born around 1530.
It is believed that she was born around 1530.
It is believed that she was born around 1530.

sen.j: 妻木城主・妻木範煕（広忠）の娘とされる。
sen.e: She is said to have been a daughter of Norihiro TSUMAKI (Hirotada), castellan of Tsumaki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She is said to have been a daughter of Norihiro TSUMAKI (Hirotada), castellan of Tsumaki-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: Tsumaki-jo Castle と修正しました。妻木範煕（広忠）については、”同一人物”、または”広忠は範煕の兄”という説があるようです。ここでは判断を仰ぐためそのままにしてあります。
sen.e: She is said to have been a daughter of Norihiro TSUMAKI (Hirotada), castellan of Tsumaki-jo Castle.

sen.j: しかし、出自については夫の光秀と同じく、はっきりしないため確証はない。
sen.e: There is not a firm evidence on her origin of place, like that of her husband, Mitsuhide.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, there is no positive proof on her origin, since that is unclear like that of her husband Mitsuhide,
sen.cmt: However を挿入、文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: However, there is no positive proof on her origin, since that is unclear like that of her husband Mitsuhide,

sen.j: 天文_(元号)14年（1545年）頃、明智光秀と婚約する。
sen.e: She was engaged to Mitsuhide AKECHI around 1545.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She was engaged to Mitsuhide AKECHI around 1545.
She was engaged to Mitsuhide AKECHI around 1545.

sen.j: しかしその後天然痘にかかり、体中にあばたが残ってしまった。
sen.e: However she had later small poxes and her face got pitted.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However she had later smallpox, and her whole body remained pockmarked.
sen.cmt: small poxes→smallpox,カンマを挿入し、後半を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: However she had later smallpox, and her whole body remained pockmarked.

sen.j: 父・範煕は、煕子と瓜二つの妹を、煕子のふりをさせて光秀のもとにやったが、光秀はそれを見破り、煕子を妻として迎えたという。
sen.e: It is said that her father Norihiro sent her sister who closely resembled Hiroko to Mitushide in disguise as Hiroko, but Mitsuhide penetrated the disguise and got married with Hiroko.
It is said that her father Norihiro sent her sister who closely resembled Hiroko to Mitushide in disguise as Hiroko, but Mitsuhide found it out and married to Hiroko.
sen.cmt: penetrated the disguise→found it out,got married with→married to と修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that her father Norihiro sent her sister who closely resembled Hiroko to Mitushide in disguise as Hiroko, but Mitsuhide found it out and married to Hiroko.

sen.j: その後、本拠の落城、浪人生活、朝倉氏・足利氏・織田氏仕官という多難な日々の中で、煕子は自分の黒髪を売って、光秀を助けたという。
sen.e: Hiroko helped Mitsuhide in his days full of difficulties--the surrender of a castle of the domain, masterless life, service to the Asakura clan, Ashikaga clan, and Oda clan--by selling her black hair.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Hiroko helped Mitsuhide in his days of difficulties--the surrender of the castle of the home ground, the masterless life, serving for the Asakura clan, Ashikaga clan, and Oda clan--by selling her black hair.
sen.cmt: full を削除しました。a→the,domain→home ground,service to→serving for, スペースを修正し、the を挿入しました。
sen.e: Hiroko helped Mitsuhide in his days of difficulties--the surrender of the castle of the home ground, the masterless life, serving for the Asakura clan, Ashikaga clan, and Oda clan--by selling her black hair.

sen.j: （しかし、これらの逸話については斎藤鎮実の妹で高橋紹運に嫁いだ妻や山内一豊の妻見性院 (山内一豊室)の話に酷似しており、後世の創作ともいう）。
sen.e: (However, some suggest that this episode is so close to the episodes of a sister of Shigezane SAITO, who became the wife of Joun TAKAHASHI, and Kenshoin, the wife of Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI that it may have been a story fabricated later.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処(山内一豊室)は意味が重なるので省略しました。
sen.e: (However, some suggest that this episode is very similar to those about the sister of Shigezane SAITO, who became the wife of Joun TAKAHASHI, and Kenshoin, the wife of Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI, that it may have been a story created later.)
sen.cmt: カッコを修正しました。so close→very similar, the episodes of→those about,a→the,fabricated→created,カンマを挿入しました。
sen.e: (However, some suggest that this episode is very similar to those about the sister of Shigezane SAITO, who became the wife of Joun TAKAHASHI, and Kenshoin, the wife of Katsutoyo YAMAUCHI, that it may have been a story created later.)

sen.j: 光秀もまた、煕子存命中は1人の側室も置かず煕子を大切にしたという。
sen.e: It is said that Mitsuhide also cared for Hiroko much and had no concubine, while she was alive.
It is said that Mitsuhide also adored Hiroko and had no concubine while she was alive.
sen.cmt: cared for→adored,much, カンマを削除しました。
sen.e: It is said that Mitsuhide also adored Hiroko and had no concubine while she was alive.

sen.j: 煕子と光秀との間に生れた子供の一人が後の細川ガラシャと呼ばれる明智珠である。
sen.e: One of the children between Hiroko and Mitsuhide was Tama AKECHI who was later called Hosokawa Garasha (Gracia) Fujin, Mrs. Sansai Hosokawa.
One of the children between Hiroko and Mitsuhide was Tama AKECHI who was later called Gracia HOSOKAWA.
sen.cmt: Hosokawa Garasha (Gracia) Fujin, Mrs. Sansai Hosokawa→Gracia HOSOKAWA と修正しました。（仕様指導書、”「新たな情報の追加」を避け”に従い）
sen.e: One of the children between Hiroko and Mitsuhide was Tama AKECHI who was later called Gracia HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 光秀が重病となった時にも必死に看病したものの、自身がその看病疲れが元で病死したという。
sen.e: It is said that she desperately took care of Mitsuhide, who suffered from a serious disease, but she died herself from the strain of looking after him.
It is said that she desperately nursed Mitsuhide when he suffered from a serious illness, but she died due to the nursing fatigue.
sen.cmt: took care of→nursed, disease→illness,後半部分を文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that she desperately nursed Mitsuhide when he suffered from a serious illness, but she died due to the nursing fatigue.

sen.j: しかし、天正10年（1582年）の坂本城落城のときに死亡したという説もある。
sen.e: However, some suggest that she died in 1582 when Sakamoto-jo Castle fell.
However, some says that she died in 1582 when the Sakamoto-jo Castle fell.
sen.cmt: suggest→says と修正し、the を挿入しました。
sen.e: However, some says that she died in 1582 when the Sakamoto-jo Castle fell.

sen.j: 滋賀県大津市の明智氏、妻木氏の菩提寺である西教寺に墓がある。
sen.e: Her grave was in Saikyo-ji Temple in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, the family temple of the Akechi clan and Tsumaki clan.
Her grave is in Saikyo-ji Temple in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, the family temple of the Akechi clan and Tsumaki clan.
